Ecosystem Connectors.description: A comprehensive suite of connectors that enable seamless integration with hundreds of third-party services. This includes connections to various large language models, embedding services, vector databases, and data loaders for diverse file formats and APIs.

files.description: This file describes the `llama-index-utils-azure` library, which provides common Azure-related utilities for various LlamaIndex packages.
This file implements a LlamaIndex reader for Azure Cognitive Search. It allows fetching documents from a specified Azure Cognitive Search index based on a query.

This README provides an overview of the LlamaIndex managed integration with Google Cloud Vertex AI, which offers a managed RAG service. It includes links to the official documentation and API reference for further information.
This file contains unit tests to verify that `VertexAIIndex` inherits from `BaseManagedIndex` and `VertexAIRetriever` inherits from `BaseRetriever`.

This file defines the VertexAIIndex class, which implements a managed index using Google Cloud's Vertex AI RAG service. It provides functionalities for creating, managing, and querying a Vertex AI RAG corpus, including importing and uploading files.

This file defines a `VertexAIRetriever` class that integrates with Google Cloud Vertex AI's Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) service. It retrieves relevant information based on a query using Vertex AI's RAG resources.
This `__init__.py` file serves as the package entry point for Vertex AI managed indices within LlamaIndex, exposing `VertexAIIndex` and `VertexAIRetriever` classes for external use.

This file implements the `DashScopeCloudIndex` class, enabling users to create, manage, and query a managed index on the DashScope cloud platform. It handles interactions with the DashScope API for document ingestion, deletion, and index lifecycle management.

This file implements the `DashScopeCloudRetriever` for LlamaIndex, enabling retrieval of nodes from a DashScope cloud index. It integrates with DashScope's API for features like query rewriting and reranking.
This file is the README for the LlamaIndex managed integration with Google services. It provides an overview of this specific integration.
Tests the `GoogleIndex` class to ensure it correctly inherits from `BaseManagedIndex`, verifying its adherence to the managed index interface.

This file implements `GoogleIndex`, a LlamaIndex managed index that integrates with Google's Generative AI Semantic Vector Store and Attributed Question and Answering (AQA) services. It allows users to create, manage, and query document corpora using Google's generative AI capabilities.
This file serves as the package initializer for the Google managed indices, exposing the `GoogleIndex` class for direct import from the package.
This file contains unit tests for the `AlibabaCloudAISearchNodeParser` class, verifying its inheritance from the `NodeParser` interface.
This file serves as the package initializer for the Alibaba Cloud AI Search node parser, exposing the `AlibabaCloudAISearchNodeParser` class for external use.

This file implements the AlibabaCloudAISearchNodeParser, a LlamaIndex node parser that utilizes Alibaba Cloud's AI Search document splitting service to break down documents into smaller, processable nodes, including handling text and rich media like images.

This README provides instructions and examples for integrating Amazon Kendra as a retriever with LlamaIndex, detailing installation, usage, configuration, and authentication methods for querying Kendra indexes.

This file contains unit tests for the `AmazonKendraRetriever` class. It specifically tests the `_retrieve` method's ability to correctly process results from the Amazon Kendra API and convert them into LlamaIndex `NodeWithScore` objects.
This file serves as the package initializer for the Kendra retriever integration, exposing the `AmazonKendraRetriever` class as part of the public API.

This file implements an AWS Kendra retriever for LlamaIndex, allowing it to fetch relevant documents from a Kendra index for a given query. It provides both synchronous and asynchronous retrieval methods and parses Kendra's response into LlamaIndex's NodeWithScore objects.

This file implements a LlamaIndex retriever for Google Cloud's Vertex AI Search service. It allows users to configure and perform search queries against Vertex AI Search data stores, supporting various data types and retrieval options.

This file implements a retriever for Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases, providing both synchronous and asynchronous methods to query Bedrock and parse the results into LlamaIndex's `NodeWithScore` objects.

This file provides utility functions to construct parameterized SQL WHERE clauses for BigQuery, translating `llama_index` metadata filters and node IDs into BigQuery-compatible filter conditions and query parameters. Benchmarking & Evaluation Suite.description: A collection of datasets and tools for evaluating and benchmarking the performance of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems. This enables developers to measure key metrics like response correctness, relevance, and overall pipeline quality.

files.description: This README provides instructions and code examples for downloading and utilizing the Mt Bench Human Judgement Dataset with LlamaIndex, including CLI and Python usage for benchmarking language models.

This README.md file describes how to download and use the Mini Covid QA dataset with LlamaIndex, providing instructions for both CLI and Python code usage, including building a basic RAG system and evaluating it with the RagEvaluatorPack.

This README provides instructions and code examples for downloading, loading, and using the 'Origin Of COVID-19 Dataset' with LlamaIndex, including setting up a RAG pipeline and performing evaluations.

This README provides instructions and code examples for downloading and utilizing the Mini Mt Bench Single Grading Dataset, which is used for evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) within the LlamaIndex framework.
This README provides instructions and code examples for downloading and utilizing the Llama 2 Paper Dataset, demonstrating its use in building and evaluating a RAG pipeline.

This README provides instructions for downloading and using the Blockchain Solana Dataset. It demonstrates how to integrate this dataset with LlamaIndex for building and evaluating Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, both via CLI and Python code.

This README file describes the 'Mini Esg Bench Dataset', providing instructions for its download and usage via CLI and Python, and demonstrating its integration with LlamaIndex for RAG pipeline evaluation. It also includes citation details for the dataset.

This README provides instructions for downloading and utilizing the Braintrust Coda Help Desk Dataset with LlamaIndex, demonstrating both CLI and Python code usage for building and evaluating RAG pipelines.

This README provides instructions and code examples for downloading and utilizing the Mini Squad V2 Dataset within LlamaIndex, particularly for building and evaluating Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines. It details both CLI and Python-based methods for dataset acquisition and integration.

This file is a README for the CovidQaDataset, providing instructions and code examples for downloading and using the dataset with LlamaIndex. It demonstrates both CLI and Python usage for setting up a RAG pipeline and evaluating it.

This README provides instructions and code examples for downloading and utilizing the Paul Graham Essay Dataset within the LlamaIndex framework. It covers both CLI and Python-based methods for setting up and evaluating a RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) system using this dataset.

This README provides instructions for downloading and utilizing the 'History Of Alexnet Dataset' with LlamaIndex. It demonstrates both CLI and Python code usage for data loading, setting up a RAG pipeline, and evaluating it.

This file sets up and runs a benchmarking process to evaluate different large language models (GPT-4, GPT-3.5, Gemini-Pro) using a human judgment dataset and pairwise comparison evaluators within the LlamaIndex framework.

This file demonstrates how to build and evaluate a RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipeline using LlamaIndex, downloading a specific dataset and an evaluation pack to benchmark its performance.

This script defines and runs a benchmark to evaluate the correctness of different Large Language Models (LLMs) (GPT-4, GPT-3.5, Gemini Pro) using the LlamaIndex `EvaluatorBenchmarkerPack` and a pre-defined evaluation dataset, then prints the aggregated results.

This file downloads a blockchain dataset, builds a basic Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a specialized LlamaPack evaluator. It includes settings for benchmarking API calls.

This script demonstrates building a basic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline using LlamaIndex, downloads a specific dataset and an evaluation pack, and then benchmarks the RAG pipeline's performance.

This script downloads a LlamaIndex dataset, builds a basic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a LlamaPack evaluator. It benchmarks the RAG system on the Paul Graham essay dataset.
This file sets up a baseline Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline for the "DocugamiKgRagSec10Q" dataset using LlamaIndex components and OpenAI, then evaluates and benchmarks its performance.

This file provides a comprehensive example script for running and benchmarking Large Language Models (LLMs) on Habana Gaudi devices, utilizing the LlamaIndex GaudiLLM integration. It supports various configurations for model loading, text generation, performance profiling, and dataset usage.
This file documents the changes and new features introduced in different versions of the `llama-index-packs-evaluator-benchmarker` package. It serves as a historical record of updates.

This README describes the 'Evaluator Benchmarker Pack', a tool designed for benchmarking LLM evaluators against Llama-datasets (single-grading or pairwise-grading). It details both CLI and Python code usage for downloading, configuring, and running benchmarks to assess evaluator performance.
This file contains unit tests for the `EvaluatorBenchmarkerPack` class, specifically verifying its inheritance from `BaseLlamaPack`.
This `__init__.py` file serves as the package entry point for the `evaluator_benchmarker` pack, making the `EvaluatorBenchmarkerPack` class available for import.

This file defines a LlamaPack for benchmarking and evaluating custom evaluators against labeled datasets. It facilitates making predictions with an evaluator and then computing and saving various evaluation metrics for both single and pairwise grading scenarios.

This document describes how to perform component-wise evaluation of workflows, focusing on evaluating retrieval and query engine components. It introduces various public benchmarks and datasets like MTEB, BEIR, and HotpotQA for in-depth analysis and model selection.

This document explains how to evaluate LLM evaluators using `LabelledEvaluatorDataset` and `LabelledPairwiseEvaluatorDataset` within LlamaIndex. It details the dataset attributes, the evaluation workflow, and provides a code example for benchmarking evaluators.

This directory is intended to store static assets, such as images or diagrams, specifically pertaining to the evaluation aspects of the LlamaIndex framework documentation. It serves as a dedicated location for non-code files that support the documentation's content on evaluating the framework's performance or features.

This directory is intended to house example code or documentation specifically related to benchmarking practices within the LlamaIndex project. It serves as a section for practical demonstrations of performance evaluation methods for LlamaIndex components. Although currently empty, its purpose is to provide concrete benchmark examples for users.

This directory is intended to house example code demonstrating the use of various tools within the LlamaIndex framework. It serves as part of the benchmark documentation, specifically for active projects in 2023.

This directory is intended to store data specifically used for examples within the LlamaIndex documentation. The data contained here pertains to experiments or demonstrations conducted using the GPT-4 model.
This file provides API reference documentation for the `EvaluatorBenchmarkerPack` within the `llama_index.packs` module.
This `__init__.py` file marks the `knowledge_graph` directory as a Python package within the test suite. It likely serves to organize tests related to knowledge graph indices.
This `__init__.py` file defines the `empty` directory as a Python package, likely for organizing and containing test-related modules or fixtures for empty indices.
This file provides mock implementations for various prediction functions, primarily used for testing the LLMPredictor in LlamaIndex by simulating responses based on different prompt types.

This file contains unit tests for the `Playground` utility in LlamaIndex, including tests for index comparison, initialization from documents, and input validation. It uses a mock embedding class for testing purposes.

This file provides utility functions for processing and displaying evaluation results (retrieval and general evaluations) in a structured format, typically using pandas DataFrames for analysis in notebooks.
This `__init__.py` file serves to expose key evaluation benchmark classes, `BeirEvaluator` and `HotpotQAEvaluator`, at the package level for `llama_index.core.evaluation.benchmarks`.
This file defines the `BeirEvaluator` class, which provides a framework for benchmarking and evaluating retrieval systems using datasets from the BEIR (Benchmarking IR) collection.

This file provides classes and utilities for evaluating query engines against the HotpotQA dataset. It includes functionality to download the dataset, prepare a mocked retriever with dataset contexts, and compute exact match and F1 scores for question-answering performance.
This file defines a `Playground` class for experimenting with and comparing the performance of different LlamaIndex index types and their retriever modes on a given query.

This `__init__.py` file initializes the `playground` module within LlamaIndex. It makes core Playground components, including the `Playground` class and default configuration constants, accessible directly from the module.

This script downloads a LlamaIndex dataset, constructs a basic RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a RagEvaluatorPack, with considerations for OpenAI API rate limits.
This script downloads a LlamaDataset, builds a basic RAG pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a RagEvaluatorPack, with considerations for OpenAI API rate limits.
This script downloads a LlamaDataset, sets up a basic RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipeline, and evaluates its performance using the RagEvaluatorPack.
This script downloads a LlamaIndex dataset, builds a basic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a RagEvaluatorPack.
This script downloads a MiniTruthfulQADataset, constructs a basic RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a RagEvaluatorPack.
This script downloads a financial benchmark dataset, builds a basic RAG pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a specialized LlamaPack evaluator.
This script downloads a COVID-19 QA dataset, constructs a basic LlamaIndex RAG pipeline, and then evaluates its performance using a RagEvaluatorPack.
This script downloads a specific Llama dataset, builds a basic Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline, and evaluates its performance using the RagEvaluatorPack.
This file implements a baseline RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipeline using LlamaIndex, downloads a specific dataset, and evaluates the RAG pipeline's performance using an evaluation pack.
This file is a changelog document that tracks version-specific changes and updates for the 'llama-index-packs-rag-evaluator' component within the LlamaIndex project.

This README describes the LlamaIndex RAG Evaluation Pack, which allows users to benchmark their Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines against a RAG dataset. It provides instructions and code examples for downloading and using the pack to evaluate metrics like correctness, relevancy, and faithfulness.

This file demonstrates how to use the `RagEvaluatorPack` from LlamaIndex to perform RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) evaluation. It sets up a basic RAG pipeline, loads a dataset, and then runs an evaluation to benchmark its performance.
This file contains unit tests for the `RagEvaluatorPack` class, verifying that it correctly inherits from `BaseLlamaPack`.

This `__init__.py` file serves as the package entry point for `rag_evaluator`, exposing the `RagEvaluatorPack` class for direct import. It makes the core RAG evaluator functionality readily available when the package is imported.

This file defines a LlamaPack for evaluating a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline. It provides functionality to generate predictions from the RAG pipeline, evaluate them using various metrics (correctness, relevancy, faithfulness, semantic similarity) and LLM-based judges, and save the evaluation results.
This file provides API reference documentation for the `RagEvaluatorPack` within the `llama_index.packs` module.

This README describes the integration of UpTrain with LlamaIndex, detailing how the UpTrainCallbackHandler can be used to evaluate various components of a LlamaIndex pipeline, including RAG query engines, sub-question generation, and re-ranking, using specific evaluation checks.
This README file introduces the LlamaIndex evaluation integration with Tonic Validate. It serves as a guide for understanding and utilizing this specific integration.

This file contains unit tests for the `llama-index-evaluation-tonic-validate` integration. Specifically, it verifies that all defined Tonic Validate evaluator classes correctly inherit from the `BaseEvaluator` class in LlamaIndex.
This file serves as the initialization file for the `tonic_validate` evaluation package. It makes various Tonic Validate evaluator classes directly accessible when the package is imported.

This file implements a LlamaIndex evaluator that uses Tonic Validate's `AnswerSimilarityMetric` to assess the similarity between a generated response and a reference response. It leverages an OpenAI service for the evaluation process.

This file defines a LlamaIndex evaluator that uses Tonic Validate's retrieval precision metric. It assesses the relevance of retrieved contexts to a given query and response, leveraging an OpenAI service for evaluation.

This file implements an `AnswerConsistencyEvaluator` for LlamaIndex, leveraging Tonic Validate's `AnswerConsistencyMetric`. It assesses how consistent an LLM's response is with its provided context, returning a score between 0.0 and 1.0.

This file implements an LlamaIndex evaluator that uses Tonic Validate's Augmentation Precision Metric to assess the precision of LLM responses based on provided contexts, utilizing an OpenAI service for evaluation.

This file defines an evaluator for LlamaIndex that integrates with Tonic Validate to assess the quality of LLM responses using various metrics like answer consistency, similarity, and augmentation precision.
This file defines an evaluator for LlamaIndex that utilizes Tonic Validate's binary answer consistency metric, scoring responses based on their consistency with provided contexts using an OpenAI LLM.

This file defines an `AugmentationAccuracyEvaluator` that uses Tonic Validate's metric to assess how accurately an LLM's response is augmented by provided contexts. It calculates a score between 0.0 and 1.0 using an OpenAI service for evaluation.

This file is a changelog documenting the historical changes and version updates for the `llama-index-packs-trulens-eval-packs` component, including dates and a summary of modifications made in each release.

This README introduces the TruLens-Eval Llama-Packs, which provide LLM observability and evaluation capabilities for LlamaIndex applications. It details how to use these packs for assessing aspects like RAG triad (context relevance, groundedness, answer relevance), harmlessness, and helpfulness, with examples for CLI and Python code usage.
This file contains unit tests to verify that the `TruLensHarmlessPack`, `TruLensHelpfulPack`, and `TruLensRAGTriadPack` classes correctly inherit from the `BaseLlamaPack` base class.

This directory contains example usage demonstrations for the `trulens-eval-packs` within the LlamaIndex ecosystem. It serves to illustrate how to integrate and utilize Trulens evaluation functionalities with LlamaIndex packs.
This file serves as the public interface for the `trulens_eval_packs` package, exporting key evaluation pack classes like `TruLensRAGTriadPack`, `TruLensHarmlessPack`, and `TruLensHelpfulPack`.

This file defines LlamaPack classes that integrate TruLens-Eval with LlamaIndex query engines. These packs instrument and evaluate RAG applications for metrics such as RAG triad (groundedness, relevance), harmlessness, and helpfulness.

This document explains how to use DeepEval for unit testing LLMs and RAG applications, particularly within the LlamaIndex framework. It covers installation, basic test case creation, various evaluation metrics, and integration with LlamaIndex evaluators.

This documentation file describes how to integrate and use Tonic Validate, a tool for evaluating Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, with LlamaIndex. It covers setup, various evaluation metrics, and an end-to-end example.

This document provides a guide on integrating UpTrain with LlamaIndex for evaluating RAG applications. It demonstrates how to use the UpTrain Callback Handler to assess various components of a LlamaIndex pipeline, including RAG query engines, sub-question generation, and re-ranking.
This file documents the `tonic_validate` module within `llama_index.evaluation`, listing various evaluators for assessing answer consistency, similarity, and augmentation quality.

This file provides API reference documentation for the `trulens_eval_packs` module within LlamaIndex, detailing its various TruLens evaluation packs such as TruLensHarmlessPack, TruLensHelpfulPack, and TruLensRAGTriadPack.

This file contains an integration test for uploading evaluation datasets to the Llama Cloud platform. It verifies that evaluation datasets can be successfully created and retrieved using the provided utilities and API client.

This module defines `KVMockLLM`, an extension of Llama Index's `MockLLM` that allows users to specify prompt-response pairs for testing. It simulates LLM behavior by returning predefined responses based on the input prompt.

This document provides a step-by-step guide on how to estimate Large Language Model (LLM) and embedding token counts within the LlamaIndex framework using mock objects and a token counting callback handler. It demonstrates the setup and usage for cost analysis.

This document explains the cost analysis for LLM calls within LlamaIndex, detailing how different index types incur costs during building and querying. It also introduces token predictors like MockLLM and MockEmbedding to estimate token usage and associated expenses.
This file contains utility functions for creating mock implementations of common text processing operations like tokenization and keyword extraction, primarily used for testing purposes.

This document provides an overview of evaluation strategies and metrics within the LlamaIndex framework for LLM applications. It discusses both end-to-end and component-wise evaluation, standard metrics like EM, Recall, Precision, and F1, and offers resources for deeper learning.

This document provides guidance on end-to-end evaluation for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) applications. It covers setting up evaluation sets, various evaluation methods (quantitative, qualitative, model-based, human), sensitivity testing, and metrics ensembling strategies.

This document explains how to evaluate LLM applications using LlamaIndex, covering both response evaluation for faithfulness and retrieval evaluation for relevance. It provides code examples and links to more detailed module guides for each evaluation type.
This file serves as a guide or index for various evaluation modules within the LlamaIndex framework, categorized by Response Evaluation and Retrieval Evaluation, with links to example notebooks.

This document guides users on evaluating retrieval systems in LlamaIndex, detailing how to use `RetrieverEvaluator` with various metrics, manually curate or synthetically generate evaluation datasets, and run batch evaluations.

This document describes how LlamaIndex provides tools and concepts for evaluating the performance of LLM applications, focusing on both response and retrieval quality. It details various evaluation modules, including LLM-based approaches, and lists integrations with community evaluation tools.

This file provides a guide on evaluating responses and RAG pipelines within the LlamaIndex framework. It details the usage of `BaseEvaluator`, specific evaluators like `FaithfulnessEvaluator` and `RelevancyEvaluator`, batch evaluation, and integrations with external tools such as DeepEval.

This directory is intended to house examples or documentation demonstrating how to evaluate the correctness of fine-tuned language models using an LLM as a judge within the LlamaIndex framework. It focuses on the specific aspect of assessing response accuracy and adherence to expected outputs.
This file provides API reference documentation for the `AnswerRelevancyEvaluator` class within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module.
This file provides an API reference for the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module, documenting key components such as `BaseEvaluator`, `EvaluationResult`, and `BatchEvalRunner`.
This file provides API reference documentation for evaluation components within `llama_index.core.evaluation`, specifically focusing on `QueryResponseEvaluator` and `RelevancyEvaluator`.
This file provides API reference documentation for the `GuidelineEvaluator` within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module.

This file provides API reference documentation for the `ContextRelevancyEvaluator` class, which is part of the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module. It details the functionality and usage of this specific evaluator within LlamaIndex.
This file provides the API reference documentation for the `CorrectnessEvaluator` within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module.
This file documents the `ResponseEvaluator` class within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module, providing API reference details for its usage.
This file provides the API reference documentation for the `SemanticSimilarityEvaluator` component within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module.

This file provides API reference documentation for the `FaithfulnessEvaluator` class within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module. It details the available options and members for this evaluation component.
This file provides the API reference documentation for the `PairwiseComparisonEvaluator` class, which is part of the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module.

This file defines a mock evaluator (`MockEvaluator`) for testing purposes, which inherits from `BaseEvaluator` and returns predefined evaluation results. It includes basic tests to ensure the mock evaluator functions correctly with different input methods.

This file contains unit tests for the `BatchEvalRunner` class, using a mock evaluator to verify its functionality. It tests the batch evaluation of responses with single and multiple evaluators and different keyword argument configurations.

This file contains unit tests for the `EvalQueryEngineTool`, verifying its functionality when evaluation passes and fails. It uses mock evaluators and query engines to isolate and test the tool's behavior.

This file defines a `CorrectnessEvaluator` class for evaluating the accuracy and relevance of a Large Language Model's (LLM) generated answers against a user query and a reference answer. It uses an LLM and a specific prompt template to assign a score and provide reasoning for the evaluation.

This file defines a semantic similarity evaluator that assesses the quality of a question answering system by comparing the embeddings of a generated answer against a reference answer. It determines 'passing' based on a configurable similarity threshold.

This file defines the `FaithfulnessEvaluator` class, which assesses whether a generated response is accurately supported by provided context documents, thereby detecting hallucinations. It utilizes LLMs and prompt templates to perform this evaluation.

This file defines the `AnswerRelevancyEvaluator` class, which uses a Large Language Model (LLM) to evaluate the relevancy of a generated response to a given query. It includes a default prompt template and parsing logic to extract a relevancy score and feedback from the LLM's output.
This file defines a `GuidelineEvaluator` class that evaluates whether a given response to a query adheres to a set of predefined guidelines, using an LLM for assessment.
This file defines an evaluator for assessing the relevancy of retrieved contexts to a given query, using an LLM to generate a score and detailed feedback based on predefined prompt templates.

This file defines the base classes and data structures for evaluating language model responses within LlamaIndex. It includes the `EvaluationResult` data model for storing evaluation outcomes and the `BaseEvaluator` abstract class, which provides an interface for custom evaluation logic, both synchronous and asynchronous.

This file implements a pairwise comparison evaluator that uses an LLM to judge and compare the quality of two AI responses to a user query, optionally against a reference. It can also enforce consensus by flipping response order and re-evaluating.

This file provides utility functions for evaluating LlamaIndex query engines, including asynchronous response retrieval, processing evaluation results, and uploading datasets and evaluation outcomes to LlamaCloud.

This file defines a `BatchEvalRunner` class that facilitates the batch evaluation of queries and responses using multiple evaluators in parallel, including robust error handling and input validation. It orchestrates asynchronous evaluation tasks, supporting different evaluation contexts and parameters.

This file defines the `RelevancyEvaluator` class, which assesses the relevancy of a language model's response and its associated contexts to a given query. It uses LLMs and customizable prompt templates to determine if the response aligns with the provided context.

This file serves as the main `__init__.py` for the `evaluation` module in LlamaIndex, aggregating and exposing various evaluators, dataset generation tools, and retrieval metrics. It provides a comprehensive set of utilities for assessing the performance and quality of LLM-based applications.

This file defines base abstractions for evaluating retrieval systems, including an evaluation result structure, evaluation modes (text/image), and an abstract base class for evaluators that can run various retrieval metrics.

This file defines core components for evaluating retrieval systems, including a standard `RetrieverEvaluator` and a specialized `MultiModalRetrieverEvaluator` for handling image and text data, with optional post-processing capabilities.

This file defines the base classes for retrieval metrics within the LlamaIndex framework. It provides a standard structure for metric results and an abstract base class for implementing various retrieval evaluation metrics.

This file defines an `EvalQueryEngineTool` class, which extends `QueryEngineTool` by incorporating an evaluator to assess the quality of the query engine's response before returning the tool's output.

This directory is intended to store image assets used within the examples provided in the LlamaIndex documentation. It serves as a dedicated location for visual content that supplements the textual examples, enhancing their clarity and understanding.

This directory is intended to house examples demonstrating the evaluation of multi-modal capabilities within the LlamaIndex documentation. Its role is to provide practical illustrations for assessing models that process diverse data types. Although currently empty, its path clearly defines its purpose.
This file provides API reference documentation for the `MultiModalRetrieverEvaluator` within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module.
This file serves as the package initializer for multi-modal evaluation modules, exposing the MultiModalRelevancyEvaluator and MultiModalFaithfulnessEvaluator classes.

This file defines a multi-modal relevancy evaluator that assesses whether a generated response aligns with a query and provided textual and image contexts. It uses a multi-modal LLM to perform the evaluation based on predefined prompt templates.

This file defines a `MultiModalFaithfulnessEvaluator` class that assesses whether a given response is supported by multi-modal contexts (text and images). It uses a multi-modal LLM to determine if the response is faithful to the provided information, rather than being hallucinated.

This directory is intended to house examples demonstrating how to evaluate retrieval mechanisms within the LlamaIndex project. Its purpose is to provide practical illustrations of retrieval evaluation techniques for benchmarking purposes, despite currently being empty.

This file provides utility functions for evaluating the performance of embedding models and retrievers, specifically for retrieval tasks. It calculates metrics like hit rate and Mean Reciprocal Rank (MRR) based on a given dataset and displays the aggregated results.

This file serves as an API reference documentation for evaluation metrics within the `llama_index.core.evaluation` module. It lists available metrics and related utilities like MRR, HitRate, and RetrievalMetricResult.
This file provides API reference documentation for core components related to retrieval evaluation within the `llama_index` library, including evaluators and result objects.

This file contains unit tests for various retrieval evaluation metrics (HitRate, MRR, Precision, Recall, AveragePrecision, NDCG) within the LlamaIndex core library. It ensures the correct calculation and error handling of these metrics.

This file defines various classes for computing common information retrieval metrics such as Hit Rate, Mean Reciprocal Rank (MRR), Precision, Recall, and Average Precision. These metrics are used to evaluate the performance of retrieval systems.

Application Monitoring & Observability.description: A framework for monitoring the performance, health, and behavior of LLM applications. It provides tools for tracing application execution and integrating with standard observability platforms to ensure reliability and diagnose issues.

files.description: This README describes the LlamaIndex Instrumentation project, which provides hooks for observability using spans, events, and dispatchers to manage their handlers.
This file contains unit tests for the instrumentation manager of the `llama-index-instrumentation` library. It specifically verifies the root manager's ability to add and track dispatchers.

This file contains unit tests for the `Dispatcher` component of the `llama_index_instrumentation` library. It verifies the behavior of the `@dispatcher.span` decorator for both synchronous and asynchronous functions and methods, including how it handles successful execution and exceptions.

This file defines the `Dispatcher` class, which manages and dispatches events and spans to registered handlers within an instrumentation system. It supports both synchronous and asynchronous event processing and handles span lifecycle (enter, exit, drop) with context awareness.

This file establishes the core components for a dispatching and instrumentation system, defining root dispatchers and managers. It also includes a mixin for automatically applying `dispatcher.span` decorators to methods in subclasses, facilitating automated tracing and event handling.
This file defines a `NullEventHandler` class, which serves as a no-operation (NOOP) event handler that does nothing when called. It implements the `BaseEventHandler` interface as a placeholder.
This file defines the `BaseEventHandler` abstract base class, which provides the foundational interface for handling events within the `llama_index_instrumentation` package.

This `__init__.py` file initializes the `event_handlers` package, exposing `BaseEventHandler` and `NullEventHandler` as core components. It serves as an entry point to the package's event handling abstractions.
This file defines the `BaseSpan` Pydantic model, serving as a foundational data structure for representing a span in a tracing or instrumentation system, including its ID, parent ID, and tags.
This file defines the `SimpleSpan` class, a basic implementation for tracking the duration and metadata of an operation or event. It records start time, end time, and calculated duration.
This file initializes core span components for instrumentation, defining base span types and a context variable to manage the active span's ID for tracing purposes.
This file acts as the package initializer for `span_handlers`, exposing various span handler implementations like `BaseSpanHandler`, `NullSpanHandler`, and `SimpleSpanHandler` for external use.

This file defines the `SimpleSpanHandler` class, which is responsible for managing `SimpleSpan` objects, including their creation, lifecycle events (start/end/drop), and organizing them into hierarchical trace trees for visualization.

This file defines the `NullSpanHandler` class, which is a no-operation (noop) implementation of a span handler. It fulfills the interface requirements of `BaseSpanHandler` without performing any actual instrumentation or tracking, effectively acting as a placeholder.

This file defines the base classes for a span handling system, including `BaseSpanHandler` for managing the lifecycle of generic spans (creating, entering, exiting, dropping) with thread-safe operations, and a `Thread` class that copies context variables for thread-local tracing.
Defines the abstract base class `BaseInstrumentationHandler` which serves as an interface for instrumentation handlers in LlamaIndex, requiring an `init` method for initialization.

This `__init__.py` file serves as the public interface for the `base` subpackage, exporting core classes like `BaseEvent` and `BaseInstrumentationHandler` for direct access. It defines fundamental components for instrumentation within the LlamaIndex framework.

This file defines the `BaseEvent` Pydantic model, serving as the foundational data structure for events within the `llama_index` instrumentation framework. It includes common event attributes like timestamp, ID, span ID, and tags.
Defines the `SpanDropEvent` class, representing an event where a span operation is dropped, typically due to an error.
This file provides the core integration for OpenTelemetry tracing within LlamaIndex, defining compatible span and event handlers to capture LlamaIndex operations as OpenTelemetry spans and events.

This file defines an event handler for differential privacy, tracking various events and computing an approximate error rate. It halts execution and reports an error if the error rate exceeds a critical threshold.

This document introduces the new `instrumentation` module in LlamaIndex, detailing its purpose to replace the legacy `callbacks` module and enable observability. It explains how to define and use custom events, event handlers, and spans for tracking application execution.

This document introduces LlamaIndex callbacks, explaining how they facilitate debugging, tracking, and tracing of the library's internal events. It details various event types that can be monitored and lists supported callback modules for different observability purposes.

This directory is designated for documentation examples showcasing instrumentation within the LlamaIndex framework. Its purpose is to provide practical demonstrations and code snippets related to monitoring and observability features. Currently, it is empty, indicating no instrumentation examples have been added yet.

This directory is intended to store image assets used within the 'observability' examples found in the LlamaIndex documentation. Its purpose is to provide visual aids and diagrams that support the accompanying textual and code explanations.

This file provides an overview of the instrumentation framework within LlamaIndex, explaining how to observe events and spans. It links to detailed documentation on event handlers, event types, span handlers, and span types.
This file documents the `BaseSpan` class from the `llama_index_instrumentation.span.base` module, detailing its API reference for instrumentation purposes.
This file provides API reference documentation for the `BaseEventHandler` class within the `llama_index` instrumentation module. It outlines the core interface for handling events in LlamaIndex.

This file documents various event types used for instrumentation within the `llama_index` library, categorizing them by their function, such as agent, chat engine, embedding, LLM, query, retrieval, and synthesis events.
This file provides API reference documentation for various span handler classes within the `llama_index_instrumentation` module, including `BaseSpanHandler` and `SimpleSpanHandler`.

This file defines the `BaseCallbackHandler` abstract base class, which serves as a blueprint for implementing callback handlers to track event starts, ends, and overall traces within the `llama_index` framework.

This file provides functions to create and set global callback handlers for various evaluation and observability tools within LlamaIndex, dynamically importing and configuring them based on a specified evaluation mode.

This file defines a base LlamaIndex callback handler that encourages and facilitates the use of standard Python logging for output instead of `print()`, serving as a foundation for other callback handlers.

This file serves as the main entry point for the `callbacks` package, aggregating and exposing core callback management components, event schemas, and various callback handlers. It defines the public API for the `llama_index.core.callbacks` module.
This file defines the base schema for callback managers in LlamaIndex, including enumeration of event types and their payloads, and data structures for individual events and their statistics.
This file defines or re-exports the `BaseInstrumentationHandler` class, serving as the foundational interface or base class for all instrumentation handlers within the LlamaIndex core library.

This file serves as the `__init__.py` for the `instrumentation` package, re-exporting core components like dispatchers, managers, and null handlers from `llama_index_instrumentation` to make them easily accessible within `llama_index.core.instrumentation`.

This file serves as a re-exporting point for core instrumentation utilities like Dispatcher, EventDispatcher, and Manager from the `llama_index_instrumentation` package, making them accessible within `llama_index.core`.
This file defines event classes for instrumenting stream chat engine operations, including events for starting, ending, errors, and receiving delta updates.
This file serves as the `__init__.py` for the `events` package, exposing the `BaseEvent` class as part of the package's public API.
This file defines event classes for instrumenting and tracking various stages of Large Language Model (LLM) operations, including prediction, completion, and chat interactions.

This file defines Pydantic models for instrumentation events related to the reranking process within LlamaIndex. It includes `ReRankStartEvent` to log the beginning of a rerank operation and `ReRankEndEvent` to log its completion and results.
This file defines the `ExceptionEvent` class, a specialized event type within the `llama_index` instrumentation system, used to encapsulate and represent an exception that has occurred.

This file defines event classes (RetrievalStartEvent and RetrievalEndEvent) used for instrumentation and tracking the beginning and end of retrieval operations within the LlamaIndex framework. These events capture the query and the retrieved nodes.

This file likely serves as the base module for instrumentation events within LlamaIndex, importing and possibly re-exporting the `BaseEvent` class to define the fundamental structure for all such events.
This file defines event classes, `QueryStartEvent` and `QueryEndEvent`, used for instrumentation to mark the beginning and end of a query operation within the LlamaIndex framework.
This file defines event classes for tracking the start and end of synthesis and response generation processes within the LlamaIndex framework. These events are used for instrumentation purposes.

This file defines event classes for instrumenting and tracking the start and end of both dense and sparse embedding generation processes within the LlamaIndex framework. These events capture details like model configuration and the generated embeddings.

This file re-exports or provides a local alias for the `SpanDropEvent` class, which is defined in the `llama_index_instrumentation` package. It serves to integrate external instrumentation events into the `llama-index-core` library's event system.
